title: Small Faithful Work
passage: A lamp for the next step.
body: I settle my breath and release the need to hurry. Today, progress is measured in honesty, not in speed.
What I bless, blesses me back. I place a quiet blessing on my body, my space, and everyone I will meet.
Gentle Courage becomes my simple liturgy: one attentive breath, one kind word, one unclenched moment.
If I forget, I begin again without insult. Beginning again is a sacred skill.
prayer: Giver of gentleness, teach my body to trust the pace of healing. Keep me faithful in small things.
